verse.verse_0: In the name of God, the Gracious, the Merciful.
verse.verse_3: What will make you understand what the Reality is?
verse.verse_4: Thamood and Aad denied the Catastrophe.
verse.verse_5: As for Thamood, they were annihilated by the Overwhelming.
verse.verse_6: And as for Aad; they were annihilated by a furious, roaring wind.
verse.verse_7: He unleashed it upon them for seven nights and eight days, in succession. You could see the people tossed around, as though they were stumps of hollow palm-trees.
verse.verse_8: Can you see any remnant of them?
verse.verse_9: Then Pharaoh came, and those before him, and the Overturned Cities steeped in sin.
verse.verse_10: But they disobeyed the messenger of their Lord, so He seized them with an overpowering grip.
verse.verse_11: When the waters overflowed, We carried you in the cruising ship.
verse.verse_12: To make it a lesson for you-so that retaining ears may retain it.
verse.verse_13: Then, when the Trumpet is sounded a single time.
verse.verse_14: And the earth and the mountains are lifted up, and crushed, with a single crush.
verse.verse_15: On that Day, the Event will come to pass.
verse.verse_16: And the heaven will crack; so on that Day it will be frail.
verse.verse_17: And the angels will be ranged around its borders, while eight will be carrying the Throne of your Lord above them that Day.
verse.verse_18: On that Day you will be exposed, and no secret of yours will remain hidden.
verse.verse_19: As for him who is given his book in his right hand, he will say, "Here, take my book and read it.
verse.verse_20: I knew I would be held accountable."
verse.verse_21: So he will be in pleasant living.
verse.verse_24: "Eat and drink merrily for what you did in the days gone by."
verse.verse_25: But as for him who is given his book in his left hand, he will say, "I wish I was never given my book.
verse.verse_26: And never knew what my account was.
verse.verse_27: If only it was the end.
verse.verse_29: My power has vanished from me."
verse.verse_31: Then scorch him in the Blaze.
verse.verse_32: Then in a chain which length is seventy cubits tie him up.
verse.verse_33: For he would not believe in God the Great.
verse.verse_34: Nor would he advocate the feeding of the destitute.
verse.verse_35: So he has no friend here today.
verse.verse_38: Indeed, I swear by what you see.
verse.verse_39: And by what you do not see.
verse.verse_40: It is the speech of a noble messenger.
verse.verse_41: And it is not the speech of a poet-little do you believe.
verse.verse_42: Nor is it the speech of a soothsayer-little do you take heed.
verse.verse_43: It is a revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
verse.verse_44: Had he falsely attributed some statements to Us.
verse.verse_45: We would have seized him by the right arm.
verse.verse_47: And none of you could have restrained Us from him.
verse.verse_48: Surely, it is a message for the righteous.
verse.verse_49: And We know that some of you will reject it.
verse.verse_50: And it is surely a source of grief for the unbelievers.
verse.verse_51: Yet it is the absolute truth.
verse.verse_52: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Magnificent.
